Posts.Content: Emma303 wrote: Hi.  I am new to the board and haven't posted before.  I have read some of your posts though and they have been really helpful.  I had a bilateral mastectomy 2 weeks ago and will start chemo in a few weeks (AC & T every 2 weeks).  My emotions are all over the place.  I cry at the drop of a hat and sometimes all I want to do is climb into bed and just stay there.  I know I need to be strong, especially as I have young kids, but it is hard to stay positive and upbeat lately. My question is around what you did work-wise during chemo.  Did you stop working or were you able to work?  I have a 3 1/2 year old and a 20 month old, and I work 3 days a week.  I was thinking of stopping working during chemo and focusing on the kids  I really feel like if I have limited energy that I should focus it on them, but I really don't know how I will feel thru all of this.  What did you do? Thanks, Emma :) Dx 10/2/2008, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 2/10 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Working during Chemo Emma303 vhqh
